New Records: South Africa scored 4-194, with Quinton de Kock contributing 74 runs and a 110-run partnership with Aiden Markram.
Kagiso Rabada took 3 crucial wickets and conceded only 18 runs in his spell.
Key Match Events: South Africa's batting performance included multiple sixes and a 53-run partnership between Heinrich Klaasen and Tristan Stubbs.
The United States' batting order, led by Andries Gous and Harmeet Singh, struggled to chase the target despite efforts.
Pre-Game Insights: The United States won the toss and opted to bat first, aiming to challenge South Africa's strong lineup.
Kagiso Rabada's experience and discipline were highlighted as key factors in the match.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa's players and coach praised the team's resilience and adaptability.
United States captain Aaron Jones expressed frustration with the team's bowling performance and regret over not crossing the finish line.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in Antigua.
The outcome marked South Africa's successful start in the Super 8s stage of the T20 World Cup.
